CTR.Q: What type of chart is this?

VEC.Q: How many stages are there in this funnel chart?

SRP.Q: Is the Design Phase stage positioned above or below the Market Release stage?
SRP.A: The Design Phase stage is positioned {above} the Market Release stage.

VPR.Q: What pattern does the data reduction follow in this funnel chart?
VPR.A: The data reduction follows a {linear} pattern.

VE.Q: What is the value of stage Prototype Development?
VE.A: The value of stage Prototype Development is {82%}.

VE.Q: What is the value of stage Design Phase?
VE.A: The value of stage Design Phase is {100%}.

VE.Q: What is the value of stage Market Release?
VE.A: The value of stage Market Release is {22%}.

EVJ.Q: What is the maximum value in the funnel chart?
EVJ.A: The stage with the highest value is Design Phase, with a value of {100%}.

EVJ.Q: What is the minimum value in the funnel chart?
EVJ.A: The stage with the lowest value is Market Release, with a value of {22%}.

SC.Q: What is the percentage reduction from stage Design Phase to stage Prototype Development?
SC.A: The percentage reduction from stage Design Phase to stage Prototype Development is {18%}.

SC.Q: What is the percentage reduction from stage Production to stage Market Release?
SC.A: The percentage reduction from stage Production to stage Market Release is {14%}.

NF.Q: In which stages of the funnel chart does the value exceed 58%? Please list the stage labels and corresponding values.
NF.A: The {Design Phase} stage has {100%}, the {Prototype Development} stage has {82%}, the {Testing and Validation} stage has {66%}.

NF.Q: In which stages of the funnel chart does the value fall below 43%? Please list the stage labels and corresponding values.
NF.A: The {Production} stage has {36%}, the {Market Release} stage has {22%}.

NF.Q: In which stages of the funnel chart does the value fall between 43% and 74%? Please list the stage labels and corresponding values.
NF.A: The {Testing and Validation} stage has {66%}, the {Final Design Approval} stage has {51%}.

NC.Q: Which reduction is greater: from stage Production to Market Release, or from stage Design Phase to Prototype Development?
NC.A: The reduction from stage {Design Phase} to {Prototype Development} is greater.

NC.Q: Which reduction is greater: from stage Final Design Approval to Production, or from stage Prototype Development to Testing and Validation?
NC.A: The reduction from stage {Prototype Development} to {Testing and Validation} is greater.

NC.Q: Which reduction is the greatest: from stage Design Phase to Prototype Development, from stage Final Design Approval to Production, or from stage Production to Market Release?
NC.A: The reduction from stage {Design Phase} to stage {Prototype Development} is the greatest.

MSR.Q: Between which two consecutive stages in the funnel chart is the conversion rate drop the largest?
MSR.A: The largest drop in conversion rate occurs between the {Design Phase} and {Prototype Development} stages.

MSR.Q: Between which two consecutive stages in the funnel chart is the conversion rate drop the smallest?
MSR.A: The smallest drop in conversion rate occurs between the {Production} and {Market Release} stages.
